Tooltip.Enabled: The shuffle step of module active/inactive splitting will be skipped
Tooltip.Disabled: Modules that are not restricted by their or others' dependencies will be shuffled during inter-step module splitting

instructions.Label: Instructions
instructions.Tooltip: Click to render the Instructions dialog

Tooltip.Enabled: All modules marked as libraries are force pinned
Tooltip.Disabled: Library modules are being treated normally

Tooltip.Enabled: All connected clients will reload along with the GM
Tooltip.Disabled: Only the GM client will reload

zeroMods.Label: Zero Modules
zeroMods.Tooltip: Reload with no modules active other than Find the Culprit. Does not start a full search

BinarySearchStep.Title: Search Step
BinarySearchStep.StatsData: Step {currentStep}: {numRemaining} modules still suspect. {remainingSteps} or fewer step(s) remain.
BinarySearchStep.ConfirmStep: Confirm Step: the only active modules are the identified culprit "{culprit}", its dependencies (if any), and your pinned modules (if any).

MissingDependencies.Title: Missing Dependencies
MissingDependencies.Unavailable: Find the Culprit is unavailable due to missing dependencies of active modules.
MissingDependencies.NotInstalledDescription: One or more modules depend on each of the following modules which are not installed. Click Log Out below to go back to setup where you can install them.
MissingDependencies.NotActiveDescription: One or more modules depend on each of the following inactive modules.
MissingDependencies.NotActiveOnlyClickInstruction: Click Enable All below to enable these modules and reload.
MissingDependencies.NotActiveNotInstalledClickInstruction: Clicking Log Out will enable these prior to logging out.

ErrorDialog.EncounteredError: Find the Culprit encountered an error:
ErrorDialog.Direction: The module's data can be found in the console as an Error to assist with bug reporting. Clicking the button below or closing this dialog will return your world to it's pre-FtC-run state.

FoundTheCulprit.Title: Sentencing
FoundTheCulprit.HasPinned: You have {count} modules pinned, any of which might be your true culprit. If you trust them, though, the listed culprit is a likely source of your issue.
FoundTheCulprit.OfferConfirmStep: The culprit was not active when indicated, so its status is currently only inferred. Click the Confirm button below to do one more step with the culprit active.
FoundTheCulprit.CulpritConfirmed: You have confirmed that the found culprit is causing an issue.

IPWOP.SomePinnedTitle: Issue in Core, System, or Pinned
IPWOP.BlameModules: , or in one of your pinned modules:
IPWOP.BlameCoreOrSystem: Seems like the issue is a bug in the game system or the core software

Instructions.Controls: Module states can be cycled through by clicking the module title or the button next to it, unless that module's state has been forced. Right clicking the button will cycle backwards. By default all modules are Suspect, except for those marked library by their authors, because the Lock Libraries toggle defaults to on.
Instructions.Tooltips: Most interactive elements have tooltips explaining their function and/or current toggle state.
Instructions.Usage: When the search starts, the page will refresh and you will be prompted to indicate if your issue persists. Follow the prompts through the steps of the search, which will narrow down the list of suspects until a single Culprit is found, after which you can return to the current active module list.
Instructions.Disclaimer: While this will be accurate for many types of issue, this process does not guarantee that the found culprit is the only module – or indeed a module – causing problems, as it cannot account for all module-module interactions. The module list splitting algorithm prevent a module from being enabled without its depdendencies, but not all module relationships are defined well enough to be accounted for this way.
Instructions.Reassurance: Any closed search step dialogs can be retrieved by reloading the page or clicking the Find the Culprit button in Module Management.

ForcedTooltip.LockedLibrary: Module is a library and the Lock Libraries toggle is enabled
ForcedTooltip.DependencyOf: Module is a dependency of pinned module(s) {pinnedDependants}

debugLevel.Name: Debug Level
debugLevel.Hint: The degree to which debugging features are enabled for Find the Culprit

StartOfRun.AllModulesDeactivated: All modules except Find the Culprit are deactivated.
StartOfRun.AllButPinnedDeactivated: All modules, except those pinned and Find the Culprit itself, are deactivated.
StartOfRun.MaxSteps: Searching will take at most {maxSteps} steps.

StateTooltip.active: Active: Currently active for this search step
StateTooltip.culprit: Culprit: The module causing (one of) your issue(s)
StateTooltip.excluded: Excluded: Disabled for the duration of the search
StateTooltip.exonerated: Exonerated: You indicated that the issue did not persist while this module was active
StateTooltip.exoneratedButActive: Exonerated (Active): Despite being exonerated, this module is active because one or more active suspect modules require it as a dependency
StateTooltip.inactive: Inactive: Still suspect, but not active this step
StateTooltip.pinned: Pinned: Active at all times during the search
StateTooltip.suspect: Suspect: A potential culprit, enabled and disabled as normal
